Articles.Content:
So, I am trying to generate some ribbons from KerbalTek, and when I hit "Insert other media-insert existing attachment," It says it is "Not available for my account. 

Very frustrated. Tried this multiple times. Can anyone help? Thanks.

We don't have attachments on this forum, you have to put images on an image hosting site and then a link to the hosted image
Once you've generated and downloaded the ribbon, upload it to somewhere like imgur.com.  When it's uploaded click on it and you get a set of links, copy the one called "direct link".  
Then click the insert other media menu and select insert image from url. Paste the url in and hit insert.  (you can also just paste the url directly into your sig or post and most times it will detect that it's an image url and display the image).
You can then double click on the image and change it's size if needed or add a link.

Forum question moved to the forum about the forum.

@katateochi is right, the image needs to be hosted elsewhere and linked.
Can I use a different image hosting site?

10 minutes ago, Lo Var Lachland said:

Can I use a different image hosting site?

Yes. Any host that gives you a link to the raw image works fine, i.e. the URL ends in .jpg or .png.

1 hour ago, katateochi said:

We don't have attachments on this forum, you have to put images on an image hosting site and then a link to the hosted image
Once you've generated and downloaded the ribbon, upload it to somewhere like imgur.com.  When it's uploaded click on it and you get a set of links, copy the one called "direct link".  
Then click the insert other media menu and select insert image from url. Paste the url in and hit insert.  (you can also just paste the url directly into your sig or post and most times it will detect that it's an image url and display the image).
You can then double click on the image and change it's size if needed or add a link.
 

Can I use a different image hosting site?

 

6 minutes ago, Red Iron Crown said:

Yes. Any host that gives you a link to the raw image works fine, i.e. the URL ends in .jpg or .png.

Thanks

One more question. I've seen people put youtube videos in posts, but I can't figure that out either. *Sigh* I'm such a noob. 

Edited May 16, 2016 by Lo Var Lachland
To embed a youtube video just paste the URL in here and press enter, the forum software will handle the rest.
first use fossil fuel, then add tectonic, then have a drink with the planet core. Let simmer ... attach ... enjoy xDr

On May 16, 2016 at 5:34 PM, Red Iron Crown said:

To embed a youtube video just paste the URL in here and press enter, the forum software will handle the rest.

Thanks a lot.
